cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn N-NW tonight, then N-NE on Wednesday, crossing Florida’s Big Bend Thursday and moving NE just offshore of the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then Atlantic coasts of GA, SC, NC, and the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east to northeast winds Friday night into Saturday could briefly reach tropical-storm force (35–40 mph) near the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft in the lower Chesapeake Bay possible during closest approach.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible as the system skirts offshore Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, hazardous surf and strong rip currents could disrupt vessel traffic and pilot transfers.
